00020 /*
00021  * IError.h
00022  *
00023  *  A way of translating between FFMPEG error codes and some xuggler defined
00024  *  values.
00025  *  
00026  *  Created on: Mar 20, 2009
00027  *      Author: aclarke
00028  */
00029 
00030 #ifndef IERROR_H_
00031 #define IERROR_H_
00032 
00033 #include <com/xuggle/ferry/RefCounted.h>
00034 #include <com/xuggle/xuggler/Xuggler.h>
00035 
00036 namespace com { namespace xuggle { namespace xuggler
00037 {
00038 
00059 class VS_API_XUGGLER IError : public com::xuggle::ferry::RefCounted
00060 {
00061 public:
00065   typedef enum {
00066     /* Unknown error */
00067     ERROR_UNKNOWN,
00068     /* IO error */
00069     ERROR_IO,
00070     /* Number expected */
00071     ERROR_NUMEXPECTED,
00072     /* Invalid data */
00073     ERROR_INVALIDDATA,
00074     /* Out of memory */
00075     ERROR_NOMEM,
00076     /* Format not supported */
00077     ERROR_NOFMT,
00078     /* Operation not supported */
00079     ERROR_NOTSUPPORTED,
00080     /* File not found */
00081     ERROR_NOENT,
00082     /* End of file or pipe */
00083     ERROR_EOF,
00084     /* Value out of range */
00085     ERROR_RANGE,
00086     /* Try again; Not enough data available on this non-blocking call */
00087     ERROR_AGAIN,
00088     /* Not supported, and the FFMPEG team wouldn't mind a patch */
00089     ERROR_PATCHWELCOME,
00090     /* Thread was interrupted while trying an IO operation */
00091     ERROR_INTERRUPTED,
00092   } Type;
00093   
00094 
00100   virtual Type getType()=0;
00101 
00113   virtual const char* getDescription()=0;
00114   
00125   virtual int32_t getErrorNumber()=0;
00126   
00134   static IError* make(int32_t errorNumber);
00135   
00142   static IError* make(Type type);
00143 
00149   static Type errorNumberToType(int32_t errorNo);
00150 
00156   static int32_t typeToErrorNumber(Type type);
00157 
00158 protected:
00159   IError();
00160   virtual ~IError();
00161 };
00162 
00163 }}}
00164 #endif /* IERROR_H_ */
